Meet the Mayor

Mark L. Stanfill, DVM

Dr. Mark Stanfill graduated from Red Oak High School and earned his bachelor’s and doctor of veterinary medicine degrees from Texas A&M University. After opening his practice in Ovilla in 1999, he and his wife settled in Red Oak where they raised their two children. Dr. Stanfill's community involvement includes service to Boy Scouts, youth sports coaching, church activities and mission work, ROISD Education Foundation, and 14 years as a Red Oak ISD trustee.

“Ellis County is on the verge of a growth explosion, whether we like it or not. The key is to manage the growth so that we can enhance the quality of life for all of Red Oak’s residents and surrounding communities.”

Term 2024 - 2027

  1. Ad Valorem Tax Rate: Fiscal Year 2025 - 2026

    The City of Red Oak adopted a tax rate that will raise more taxes for maintenance and operations than last year's tax rate.
    The tax rate will effectively be raised by 3.5 percent and will raise taxes for maintenance and operations on a $100,000 home by approximately $15.45
